meanings.definition: Placed or laid over something else, typically in order to compare or combine the two.
meanings.sent1: The superimposed image showed the before and after pictures side by side.
meanings.sent2: The superimposed layers of paint created a unique and colorful artwork.
meanings.sent3: The superimposed hats on the clown made him look even sillier!
meanings.sent4: Her superimposed emotions painted a complex picture of her inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The superimposed shadows cast an eerie effect on the wall.

meanings.definition: To lay or place something over or on top of something else.
meanings.sent1: She superimposed the new logo onto the company letterhead.
meanings.sent2: The architect superimposed the new building design over the existing blueprint.
meanings.sent3: He superimposed his face onto a famous painting for a funny meme.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood superimposed themselves over the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves superimposed a calming effect on the busy city sounds.
